intro: Campanula takhtadzhianii, commonly known as the Takhtadzhian bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Turkey and northern Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and a compact, upright growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
